FuncDef:
The upe-upe mac-withdraw enable command configures an NPE to forward the LDP MAC Withdraw messages received from a UPE to other UPEs.
The undo upe-upe mac-withdraw enable command disables an NPE from forwarding the LDP MAC Withdraw messages received from a UPE to other UPEs.
By default, an NPE does not forward the LDP MAC Withdraw messages received from a UPE to other UPEs.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
This command is mainly used on the gateway on the Metro Ethernet where:
NPE refers to the network end peer of the local VSI in HVPLS. You can run the peer  [ negotiation-vc-id  ] [ tnl-policy  ] command to specify an NPE.UPE refers to the user end peer of the local VSI in HVPLS. You can run the peer  [ negotiation-vc-id  ] [ tnl-policy  ] upe command to specify a UPE.If the local device is not configured with HVPLS, the upe-upe mac-withdraw enable command is not required.
